TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MobileFormsAuthentication extends System.Object

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

summary.span: 通过向相应的 URL 追加相应的身份验证信息来支持无 Cookie 设备。

span.span: Supports cookieless devices by appending appropriate authentication information to the appropriate URLs.

summary.span: 若要了解如何开发 ASP.NET 移动应用，请参阅 Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET (ASP.NET 移动应用和网站)。

span.span: For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此帮助程序类旨在帮助编写经过身份验证的移动网站。This helper class is designed to assist with writing authenticated mobile Web sites. 类对象提供移动设备兼容版本的 ASP.NET 类方法 和 。The class objects provide mobile device-compatible versions of the ASP.NET class methods, and . 有关保护 Web 应用程序的详细信息，请参阅[Web 应用程序的基本安全实践](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/3eeeee9e-b09f-4c7f-8ce5-d9ca1f9322ad)。For more information on securing your Web application, see [Basic Security Practices for Web Applications](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/3eeeee9e-b09f-4c7f-8ce5-d9ca1f9322ad). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示了一个登录 .aspx 页。The following code example shows a login.aspx page. 使用 函数验证身份验证。The authentication is validated using the function. 类依赖于成员资格提供程序来与数据源进行通信。The class relies on membership providers to communicate with a data source. [!code-aspx-csharp[MobileFormsAuthentication#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileFormsAuthentication/CS/MobileFormsAuth.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[MobileFormsAuthentication#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileFormsAuthentication/VB/MobileFormsAuth.aspx#1)]

permission.span: 用于在宿主环境中进行操作。

span.span: for operating in a hosted environment.
Demand value: ; Permission value: .

summary.span: 将已验证身份的用户重定向回最初请求的 URL。

span.span: Redirects an authenticated user back to the originally requested URL.
This API is obsolete.

summary.span: 若要了解如何开发 ASP.NET 移动应用，请参阅 Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET (ASP.NET 移动应用和网站)。

span.span: For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void RedirectFromLoginPage (string userName, bool createPersistentCookie);
.method public static hidebysig void RedirectFromLoginPage(string userName, bool createPersistentCookie) cil managed
Public Shared Sub RedirectFromLoginPage (userName As String, createPersistentCookie As Boolean)
public: static void RedirectFromLoginPage(System::String ^ userName, bool createPersistentCookie);
static member RedirectFromLoginPage : string * bool -> unit

param.name: userName
param.span: 用于 Cookie 身份验证的用户名称。

span.span: Name of the user for cookie authentication purposes.

param.span: 这不需要映射到帐户名称，并将由 URL 身份验证使用。

span.span: This does not need to map to an account name and is used by URL Authorization.

param.name: createPersistentCookie
param.span: 指定是否必须发出持久 Cookie（基于会话或比会话更持久的 Cookie）。

span.span: Specifies whether or not a durable cookie (one that is session based or outlasts the session) must be issued.

summary.span: 登录后将已验证身份的用户重定向到最初请求的 URL。

span.span: Redirects an authenticated user to the originally requested URL after logging in.
This API is obsolete.

summary.span: 若要了解如何开发 ASP.NET 移动应用，请参阅 Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET (ASP.NET 移动应用和网站)。

span.span: For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法从身份验证 cookie 创建加密的字符串，并将其附加到原始请求的重定向 URL。The methods create an encrypted string from the authentication cookie and append it to the redirecting URL of the originating request. 然后，将为该 URL 发出客户端重定向。A client-side redirect is then issued for that URL. 这可用于解决某些移动设备的限制，这些限制不支持 cookie，或支持太小而无法以安全方式存储身份验证信息的 cookie。This can be used to work around the limitations of certain mobile devices that either do not support cookies, or support cookies that are too small for storing authentication information in a secure manner. ## Examples 下面的示例使用 方法将经过身份验证的用户发送到最初请求的 URL。The following example uses the method to send an authenticated user to the originally requested URL. [!code-aspx-csharp[MobileFormsAuthentication#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileFormsAuthentication/CS/MobileFormsAuth.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[MobileFormsAuthentication#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileFormsAuthentication/VB/MobileFormsAuth.aspx#1)]

.method public static hidebysig void RedirectFromLoginPage(string userName, bool createPersistentCookie, string strCookiePath) cil managed
Public Shared Sub RedirectFromLoginPage (userName As String, createPersistentCookie As Boolean, strCookiePath As String)
public: static void RedirectFromLoginPage(System::String ^ userName, bool createPersistentCookie, System::String ^ strCookiePath);
static member RedirectFromLoginPage : string * bool * string -> unit

param.name: userName
param.span: 用于 Cookie 身份验证的用户名称。

span.span: Name of the user for cookie authentication purposes.

param.span: 这不需要映射到帐户名称，并将由 URL 身份验证使用。

span.span: This does not need to map to an account name and is used by URL Authorization.

param.name: createPersistentCookie
param.span: 指定是否必须发出持久 Cookie（基于会话或比会话更持久的 Cookie）。

span.span: Specifies whether or not a durable cookie (one that is session based or outlasts the session) must be issued.

param.name: strCookiePath
param.span: 返回用于当前应用程序的已配置 Cookie 路径。

span.span: Returns the configured cookie path used for the current application.

summary.span: 登录后将已验证身份的用户重定向到最初请求的 URL。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法从身份验证 cookie 创建加密的字符串，并将其附加到原始请求的重定向 URL。The methods create an encrypted string from the authentication cookie and append it to the redirecting URL of the originating request. 然后，将为该 URL 发出客户端重定向。A client-side redirect is then issued for that URL. 这可用于解决某些移动设备的限制，这些限制不支持 cookie，或支持太小而无法以安全方式存储身份验证信息的 cookie。This can be used to work around the limitations of certain mobile devices that either do not support cookies, or support cookies that are too small for storing authentication information in a secure manner. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用 方法将经过身份验证的用户发送回最初请求的 URL。The following example demonstrates how to use the method to send the authenticated user back to the URL that was originally requested.
